H0.text: Runoff from sewage is the direct result that creates a delta at the mouth of a river.

H1.text: Deposition of sediment is the direct result that forms a delta at the mouth of a river.

H2.text: An ancient glacier that passed through is the direct result that creates a delta at the mouth of a river.

H3.text: An underground river flowing to the ocean is the direct result of a delta at the mouth of a river.

A4.text: A river delta is created by the deposition of the sediments that are carried by the waters of a river.
